intro: Philadelphus matsumuranus, commonly known as the Japanese mock orange, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Philadelphus matsumuranus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
